name: CoRoT-18
scenarioDescription:
The CoRoT-18 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoT-18 is a star with 0.95 times the mass of the Sun, and 1 times its radius. It is located 2837.5571999999997 light years away from the solar system.

CoRoT-18 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoT-18 system

CoRoT-18 b

CoRoT-18 b was discovered by the CoRoT observatory using the Transit method. The mass of CoRoT-18 b is 1102.82 times the mass of Earth. The radius of CoRoT-18 b is 14.68 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, CoRoT-18 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, CoRoT-18 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoT-18, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by CoRoT.
